abstract: Bank of America is trying to avoid paying billions of dollars in fees to U.S. taxpayers for guarantees against losses at Merrill Lynch, saying the rescue agreement was never signed and the funds never used, Bloomberg News reported.
snippet: Bank of America is trying to avoid paying billions of dollars in fees to U.S. taxpayers for guarantees against losses at Merrill Lynch, saying the rescue agreement was never signed and the funds never used, Bloomberg News reported.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America is trying to avoid paying billions of dollars in fees for government guarantees against losses at Merrill Lynch, saying the rescue agreement was never signed and the funding never used, Bloomberg News reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: Bank of America Said to Balk at Fees for Merrill Guarantees
